SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.convert

Class ConverterFactory

java.lang.Object
ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.convert.ConverterFactory
public abstract class ConverterFactory extends Object
An abstract factory class responsible for creating Converter instances that facilitate the transformation between XML and JSON representations.

The ConverterFactory class serves as the central point for obtaining various converters necessary for serializing and deserializing XML and JSON data. It leverages the application's configuration settings to determine whether to use a default factory implementation or a custom one specified by the user. This design promotes flexibility and extensibility, allowing developers to inject custom conversion logic as needed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Providing converters for transforming XMLDocument and XMLElement instances to JSONObject and vice versa.
  • Managing the creation and retrieval of name converters for XML and JSON field naming strategies.
  • Handling configuration-based factory instantiation, supporting both default and custom factory implementations.

Example Usage:


 // Obtain the ConverterFactory instance based on configuration
 ConverterFactory converterFactory = ConverterFactory.getFactory();

 // Get a converter to transform XMLDocument to JSONObject
 Converter<XMLDocument, JSONObject> xmlToJsonConverter = converterFactory.getXMLDocumentToJSONConverter();

 // Convert an XMLDocument to JSONObject
 XMLDocument xmlDocument = ...; // Assume this is provided
 JSONObject jsonObject = xmlToJsonConverter.convert(xmlDocument);

 // Similarly, get a converter to transform JSONObject to XMLDocument
 Converter<JSONObject, XMLDocument> jsonToXmlConverter = converterFactory.getJSONDocumentToXMLConverter();
 XMLDocument convertedXmlDocument = jsonToXmlConverter.convert(jsonObject);

Exception Handling:

  • ClassCastException: Thrown if the specified custom factory class does not extend ConverterFactory.
  • RuntimeException: Thrown for errors related to class loading, instantiation, or reflection failures when attempting to load a custom factory.

Thread Safety:

The ConverterFactory class is thread-safe for concurrent read operations. However, the underlying MAPPERS map in XMLDocument is not thread-safe. If multiple threads are expected to bind or unbind mappers concurrently, appropriate synchronization mechanisms or thread-safe collections (e.g., ConcurrentHashMap) should be used.

Best Practices:

  • Use the getFactory() method to obtain the appropriate ConverterFactory instance based on the current configuration.
  • When implementing custom converters, ensure they adhere to the expected interface contracts to maintain compatibility.
  • Handle exceptions gracefully, providing meaningful error messages to aid in debugging and maintenance.
  • Ensure that custom factory classes specified in the configuration are available in the classpath and correctly implement ConverterFactory.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ConverterFactory

      public ConverterFactory()

  • Method Details

    • getFactory

      @NotNull public static @NotNull ConverterFactory getFactory()
      Retrieves the appropriate ConverterFactory instance based on the current configuration.

      If the configuration indicates that a custom factory class should be used, this method attempts to load and instantiate it via reflection. If the configuration is not loaded or specifies to use the default factory, the default ConverterFactoryImpl is returned.

      Example:

      
 ConverterFactory factory = ConverterFactory.getFactory();
      Returns:
      An instance of ConverterFactory, either the default implementation or a custom one as specified by the configuration.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - If the specified custom factory class does not extend ConverterFactory.
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the loading or instantiation of the custom factory class.

    • getXMLDocumentToJSONConverter

      public abstract Converter<XMLDocument,JSONObject> getXMLDocumentToJSONConverter()
      Retrieves a converter that transforms XMLDocument instances into JSONObject instances.

      This converter facilitates the conversion of entire XML documents into their JSON representations, enabling interoperability between XML and JSON data formats.

      Returns:
      A Converter that converts XMLDocument to JSONObject.

    • getXMLElementToJSONConverter

      @NotNull public abstract @NotNull Converter<XMLElement,JSONObject> getXMLElementToJSONConverter()
      Retrieves a converter that transforms XMLElement instances into JSONObject instances.

      This converter facilitates the conversion of individual XML elements into their JSON representations, allowing for granular control over the serialization process.

      Returns:
      A Converter that converts XMLElement to JSONObject.

    • getJSONDocumentToXMLConverter

      public abstract Converter<JSONObject,XMLDocument> getJSONDocumentToXMLConverter()
      Retrieves a converter that transforms JSONObject instances into XMLDocument instances.

      This converter facilitates the conversion of JSON data into XML document structures, enabling bidirectional data format transformations.

      Returns:
      A Converter that converts JSONObject to XMLDocument.

    • getJSONObjectToXMLElementConverter

      @NotNull public abstract @NotNull JSONObjectToXMLElementMapper getJSONObjectToXMLElementConverter()
      Retrieves a mapper that transforms JSONObject instances into XMLElement instances.

      This mapper is used to convert JSON objects into corresponding XML elements, supporting the creation of XML structures based on JSON data.

      Returns:
      A JSONObjectToXMLElementMapper that maps JSONObject to XMLElement.

    • getToXMLConverter

      public abstract NameConverter getToXMLConverter()
      Retrieves the NameConverter used for converting JSON field names to XML field names.

      This converter defines the strategy for mapping JSON field naming conventions to XML naming conventions, ensuring consistency and adherence to XML standards.

      Returns:
      The NameConverter used for XML field name conversions.

    • getToJSONConverter

      public abstract NameConverter getToJSONConverter()
      Retrieves the NameConverter used for converting XML field names to JSON field names.

      This converter defines the strategy for mapping XML field naming conventions to JSON naming conventions, facilitating accurate and meaningful JSON representations of XML data.

      Returns:
      The NameConverter used for JSON field name conversions.

    • getAttributePrefix

      public abstract String getAttributePrefix()
      Retrieves the prefix used for XML attributes during conversion processes.

      This prefix is applied to attribute names to distinguish them from element names, ensuring clear differentiation between attributes and elements in the XML structure.

      Returns:
      A String representing the attribute prefix.

    • getDefaultRootName

      public abstract String getDefaultRootName()
      Retrieves the default root element name used when converting JSON data to XML.

      If the JSON data does not specify a root element, this default name is used to create the root of the resulting XML document.

      Returns:
      A String representing the default root element name.

    • getTextPlaceholder

      public abstract String getTextPlaceholder()
      Retrieves the placeholder string used to represent text content within XML elements.

      This placeholder is used during the conversion process to handle text nodes, ensuring that textual data within XML elements is appropriately captured and represented.

      Returns:
      A String representing the text placeholder.

    • getCharacterDataPlaceholder

      public abstract String getCharacterDataPlaceholder()
      Retrieves the placeholder string used to represent character data within XML elements.

      This placeholder is used during the conversion process to handle character data sections, ensuring that character data within XML elements is appropriately captured and represented.

      Returns:
      A String representing the character data placeholder.
